summary: York is a historic city in northern England, known for its beautiful cathedral (called a minster) and ancient buildings. Founded by Romans over 2000 years ago, it has been an important place for many different kingdoms and groups over the centuries. York grew as a trading center, especially for wool, and later became a major train hub and candy-making center. Though some buildings were damaged in World War II, many have been restored. Today, York is a popular place to visit and has a population of around 200,000 people.
title: York
